title: World Cup semi final coverage disrupted by cyber attack on streaming service FuboTV; FuboTV has reported the cyber attack to law enforcement.
text:
FuboTV's stock tumbled 6% on Thursday and hit a 52-week low of $2.15, outpacing the S&P 500 index's SPX decline of 2.8%. Shares of the TV streaming service have fallen 85.9% in 2022, compared with the S&P 500 index's decline of 18.6%.

See Now: For Budweiser, Qatar World Cup has been a tale of tough logistics and quick thinking

The game between underdogs Morocco, the first African team to reach the World Cup semifinals and France, the defending World Cup winners, was one of the competition's most eagerly anticipated.

Some users took to social media to voice their frustration Wednesday. "May God, Allah and Manitou curse FUBO Tv," tweeted one. "They are down for the most important game of the decade."

"Fubo TV having a multiple-hour outage the day of the semi-finals, is a complete travesty," tweeted another.

See: Qatar World Cup controversy means sponsors are walking a tightrope

"Once we detected the attack, we immediately took steps to contain the incident and worked to restore service to all of our users as quickly as possible," the company added. "Service was fully restored by last evening. We deeply regret the disruption caused by this incident in the meantime."

FuboTV has reported the attack to law enforcement and engaged cybersecurity specialist Mandiant, which is a subsidiary of Alphabet Inc.'s GOOG GOOGLGoogle, to assist in its investigation and response. "Our primary focus currently is on ensuring that the incident is fully contained and that there is no threat of further disruption for any of our customers," the company said.

The company's investigation is at an early stage, but FuboTV said it will provide an update "at an appropriate time" when it has more information to share.

Now read: British band the Farm blocks McDonald's from using hit song in Qatar World Cup ad

A number of customers called for a refund from FuboTV. "Yea, i'm going to need a credit and a refund for fubo being down today," tweeted Odeen Domingo. "lmk when i can expect that."

"We will provide an update when have more information to share," a spokesperson for Fubo TV told MarketWatch.

France defeated Morocco 2-0 on Wednesday and will face Lionel Messi's Argentina on Sunday in the World Cup final.

Fox Sports, which is owned by Fox Corp., FOX the sister company of MarketWatch publisher Dow Jones's parent company, News Corp NWSA, holds English-language broadcast rights in the U.S. to the Qatar World Cup.

World Cup semi final coverage disrupted by cyber attack on streaming service FuboTV
